p: O. vulgare L. was collected in the Socoroma town (18°15′4.67″ S; 69°36′7.44″ W, 2945 masl), northern Chile in April 2020 and was identified and deposited in the Herbarium of the Department of Botany of the University of Concepción, Chile (voucher specimen 184934). The oregano sample was dried in a freeze-dryer (Virtis Benchtop model, 3L, Gardiner, NY, USA) for about 48 h with the condenser temperature and chamber vacuum at −50 °C and 12.5 Pa, respectively.
